content.description:
An awkward mantle past the first bolt gains entry into the tiered corner system where jamming skills are a plus. The so-so climbing in the middle of the route is redeemed by the wild and suprisingly exposed feeling crux at the last bolt.

The extension to this is called Hysteria (5.12d) 15 bolts to anchors (115').
content.location: Located on the far right side of The Alcove and identified as a left-facing corner system that starts up high - this is currently the third route from the right. Some scrambling is required to reach the base, but once there a nice sheltered spot exists to belay.

content.description:
Step off the ground (avoiding a loose jug) and climb over a steep, orange roof at the second bolt. Shorter climbers may find a kneebar here to make the roof a little easier. From there climb up easier ground and through a short band of low angle choss.

The angle then kicks back again as you climb some big holds up moderate ground before the climbing gets technical and pumpy near the top.

2-3 stars, worth doing.

The extension "Tweaker" continues past 8 more bolts at 13b.
content.location: Starts near large green and black graffiti, and climbs over a low roof with a bright orange streak of rock.

content.description: Fun moves between good rests. Reachy crux move halfway up or so. A great route that is well worth doing. The Alcove stays shady slightly longer than almost anywhere else at the Quarry.
content.protection: 9 bolts to a pair of rap rings
content.location: In the middle of the Alcove, starting off a boulder. 10-15 feet left of the rebar ladder.

content.description:
Relatively moderate but pumpy climbing leads to a sloping ledge at about 1/3. From there you pass the first crux of the route, surmounting the small roof by pulling on some small crimps in a crack that angles up and left.

After that the climbing remains fairly sustained and technical, working your way up on the right of the drill flute, using a variety of interesting sidepulls, liebacks, and compression. As you near the first anchors staying to the left is easier.

Climbing to the first anchors is 11d, quite fun, and relatively solid. Worth doing.

The full route continues up to a second set of anchors at 12a, though aside from accumulated fatigue it doesn't seem any harder than the bottom. It is generally dirty, the rock is a bit chossy, but the movement is good. You climb up past a perma-draw, pulling lightly on the scary looking jug, before cranking a couple tough moves over the bulge. From there some delicate slab climbing zigzags up before the final stretch where you climb directly up the drill flute which is neat. L-P-L if you go to the top.
content.protection: 14(?) bolts to first anchor, 22 to the top. Hooks at both anchors. L-P-L if you go to the top.
content.location: 10' right of Toothless Tweaker (with the orange roof), Character Assassination climb a line just right of the drill flute.

content.description:
This route is just to the right of

Rocky

which is the last route in the Taboo Area.
content.protection: 13 bolts, anchors. The extension to this is called Crazy Town (5.13b) with 20 bolts.
content.location: First route in the Alcove Area.
